channel.title: Forcing a full screen app into it's own window?
channel.description: So recently, I downloaded the original resident evil 1 for pc, it has 2 options for graphics: 320 x 220 FULLSCREEN 640 x 440 FULLSCREEN Now, this doesn't bother me that it's so small, it's just, displaying 640 x 440 on a 1280 x 800 screen kinda stretches it an awful lot, so does anyone know if I can force it into it's own app? If it makes any difference, it uses DX 3c.

item.title: Forcing a full screen app into it's own window?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

So recently, I downloaded the original resident evil 1 for pc, it has 2 options for graphics:
320 x 220 FULLSCREEN
640 x 440 FULLSCREEN
Now, this doesn’t bother me that it’s so small, it’s just, displaying 640 x 440 on a 1280 x 800 screen kinda stretches it an awful lot, so does anyone know if I can force it into it’s own app? If it makes any difference, it uses DX 3c.

Read full topic
item.source: Forcing a full screen app into it's own window?
